On Wednesday 22 December 2004 07:57, berndq@... wrote:
> I assume you are waiting for Quartz to call a method
> in one of your tested code, right?

Yes, exactly.

> In cases like this I call the method directly from the test code.

In the general case, where I know what I'm doing (or so I hope), that's 
what I'm doing. And in fact I have another test case that does just 
that. The point of this specific case, though, is to make sure that my 
understanding of Quartz and the other frameworks involved is correct. 
For that purpose I do need to keep them in the loop instead of skipping 
over or mocking them.

Michael
